<<<<<<< HEAD
Meditations and praiers gathered out of the sacred letters and vertuous writers disposed in fourme of the alphabet of the Queene Her most excellent Maiesties name : whereunto are added comfortable consolations (drawen out of the Latin) to afflicted mindes. Conway, John, Sir, d. 1603.
[416+] p.
By William How, Imprinted at London : 1571.
Running title: The posye of flowred praiers. Dedication signed: I. Conway. Signatures: A-2D⁸ 2E⁶ (last leaf blank). Imperfect: signatures D₁₊₈, Y₁, Y₈, 2E₁,₃₊₄ blank. Reproduction of original in the John Rylands University Library of Manchester.
=======

[416+] p.
By William How, Imprinted at London : 1571.
Running title: The posye of flowred praiers. Dedication signed: I. Conway. Signatures: A-2D⁸ 2E⁶ (last leaf blank). Imperfect: signatures D₁₊₈, Y₁, Y₈, 2E₁,₃₊₄ blank. Reproduction of original in the John Rylands University Library of Manchester.
